    Used for logging.

Detailed Description

The SimpleBalancer will stop loading maps when all modules are loading, just like the old system.

This is to avoid problems with slow modules that can get a queue of many LoadMapRequestPackets and delay all the jobs. It is also more difficult to determine how much memory is used, since the sizes of the maps are not known beforehand.

moduleName The name of this module (for logging purposes).
ownStatistics Initial statistics packet for this module
usesMaps Whether the module uses maps.
multipleMaps True for those modules the can have multiple instances for each map. (Eg not InfoModule)

void SimpleBalancer::getNoticeOrSendAck (  PacketSendList &  packetList,
const RequestPacket *  request,
bool &  ok
)  [protected]
 

Checks if the map id of the request packet exists in the allmaps vector and if it doesn't, it sends an ack packet to the sender.

If the map ID is MAX_UINT32 there is no such map, but ok will be true. The following combinations can be returned:
Return value Value of ok Comment
Valid notice true Map was found
NULL true Map id was MAX_UINT32 - map does not matter
NULL false MapID was not found in allmaps.

Parameters:
ok Outparameter which will be set to true if the request was ok, i.e. if the map exists or the map id of the request was MAX_UINT32.

uint32  mapID,
ModuleNotice *  mn
)  [protected]

bool SimpleBalancer::readPropValues (  const MC2String &  prefix = "",
const MC2String &  suffix = ""
)  [protected]
 

Reads values from the properties If e.g.

MODULE_MAX_MEM for RouteModule is about to be read and the map set is set to 0, the following order will be used:

  1. MODULE_MAX_MEM
  2. MODULE_MAX_MEM_0
  3. ROUTE_MODULE_MAX_MEM
  4. ROUTE_MODULE_MAX_MEM_0

virtual void SimpleBalancer::sendAcknowledge (  PacketSendList &  packetList,
RequestPacket *  pack,
uint32  eta,
bool  refuse = false
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Acknowledge or refuse a packet to the sender.

NB! Does not delete the packet if refusing. Virtual to enable different behaviour for subclasses.

Parameters:
pack The packet to reply to.
eta The expected time of the response.
refuse If set to true the packet was refused.
